binaryEncoding.description: A content encoding scheme, as described in RFC 2045

type.description: A media type, as described in RFC 2046

pathStart.description: Instances' URIs must start with this value for this schema to apply to them

encType.description: The media type in which to submit data along with the request

href.description: a URI template, as defined by RFC 6570, with the addition of the $, ( and ) characters for pre-processing

mediaType.description: media type (as defined by RFC 2046) describing the link target

method.description: method for requesting the target of the link (e.g. for HTTP this might be "GET" or "DELETE")

rel.description: relation to the target resource of the link

schema.description: Schema describing the data to submit along with the request

targetSchema.description: JSON Schema describing the link target

http://json-schema.org/draft-04/hyper-sc.description: If true, indicates that the value of this property is controlled by the server.

base.description: URI Template resolved as for the 'href' keyword in the Link Description Object.  The resulting URI Reference is resolved against the current URI base and sets the new URI base for URI references within the instance.

binaryEncoding.description: A content encoding scheme, as described in RFC 2045

type.description: A media type, as described in RFC 2046

readOnly.description: If true, indicates that the value of this property is controlled by the server.

href.description: a URI template, as defined by RFC 6570

hrefSchema.description: a schema for validating user input to the URI template, where the input is in the form of a JSON object with property names matching variable names in "href"

mediaType.description: media type (as defined by RFC 2046) describing the link target

rel.description: relation to the target resource of the link

submissionEncType.description: The media type in which to submit data along with the request

submissionSchema.description: Schema describing the data to submit along with the request

targetSchema.description: JSON Schema describing the link target
